instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Liquid
threads.message: hello I have 1 motherboard <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a that took liquid in the <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> in the <TRANSISTOR>Q7760</TRANSISTOR> I changed the 2 components, but I don't have 20V in the F3000-F3010, who generates 20 volts?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Liquid
threads.message:
Do you get any voltage at USB-C meter?
Both ports have the same behaviour?

Post exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Liquid
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>   
starts with 12v then goes down to 8v and then goes up again 12v is not stable.
f3010 no I get 20v only 4.5v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Liquid
threads.message:
Check for short on all secondary power rails.
Do you get stable voltage at <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>?
You may need to reflow/reball <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Liquid
threads.message: I have this in short bat i cheng this with new ic ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Liquid
threads.message: I removed them from another working motherboard :cry:
